title: China’s Leadership Takes Shape as Xi Aide Steps Into Premier Job
description: President Xi Jinping will complete his shake-up of China’s top personnel this weekend, starting Saturday with a legislative vote to install a key ally and former aide as premier — the leader of the country’s cabinet.

title: UK to Spend £20 Billion on Carbon Capture in Clean Energy Push
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt will announce £20 billion ($24 billion) for domestic carbon capture projects over the next 20 years in his budget next week, as the UK seeks to hit its net zero targets and spur green jobs.

title: Biden Officials Back Alaska Oil Project That Critics Call a Climate Catastrophe
description: The Biden administration has decided to authorize a mammoth ConocoPhillips oil project in northwest Alaska, rejecting arguments from environmental activists who insist it will push the world closer to climate catastrophe, according two people familiar with the matter.

title: Apple Called Out by New Jersey AG Over Period-Tracking Apps
description: Apple Inc. has been “delinquent” in confirming to state officials that the company is protecting the privacy of women who use period-tracking apps, New Jersey’s top law enforcement officer said.

title: Businesses Urge Biden to Use ‘Every Tool’ in Mexico Energy Spat
description: Business groups representing American oil producers, renewable electricity and manufacturers urged the Biden administration to use “every tool available” to push Mexico to address complaints about its nationalist energy policy that the US says violates their free-trade agreement.

title: Texas Man Sues Women He Says Helped Ex-Wife Obtain Abortion Pill
description: A Texas man who says his ex-wife used an abortion pill to end her pregnancy without his knowledge is suing three women who helped her, invoking the state’s wrongful death law in one of the first such cases since Texas banned almost all abortions last year.

title: Colombian Banks Slash Interest Rates on Credit Cards After Political Pressure
description: Colombian banks are slashing interest rates on credit cards by as much as 26 percentage points in response to pressure from the government of President Gustavo Petro, which is seeking to prevent a sharp slowdown in consumer spending.

title: Biden Administration Set to Further Tighten Chipmaking Exports to China
description: The Biden administration is working to further tighten restrictions on the export of semiconductor manufacturing gear to China, escalating rules aimed at preventing the country from developing an advanced chip industry.

title: US-EU Seek Deal on Minerals Used in EVs in Race for Green Investments
description: The US and European Union are seeking a preliminary agreement on the supply of so-called critical minerals used in electric vehicles, a step toward Washington’s efforts to reduce the global reliance on China for materials necessary for green-energy technologies.

title: US Lifts Covid Test Rule for Air Travelers From China
description: Air travelers from China, Hong Kong or Macau no longer need to show proof of a negative Covid-19 test before boarding a flight to the US, health officials said Friday.

title: Yellen Says Bank System Remains Resilient in Wake of SVB Failure
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Friday reacted to the largest failure by a US lender in more than a decade by declaring the US banking system “remains resilient” and regulators “have effective tools” to address fallout from the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank.

title: EU Offers E-Fuel Exemption to Germany in Bid to Save Combustion Car Ban
description: Volker Wissing, general secretary of the Free Democratic Party (FDP), delivers a statement during a news conference at the party's headquarters in Berlin, Germany, on Wednesday, Sept. 29, 2021. The Greens and FDP, which have contrasting policies in key areas like climate and finance, are sounding each other out, and a second round of talks, including more officials, will be held on Friday.

title: US Budget Deficit Hits $723 Billion Five Months Into Fiscal Year
description: The US federal government’s budget deficit widened in February by $262 billion, bringing the gap for the first five months of the fiscal year to $723 billion.

title: Chile’s Boric Shuffles Cabinet After Crushing Defeat in Congress
description: Chilean President Gabriel Boric reorganized his cabinet for the second time in less than a year after lawmakers handed his administration a crushing defeat by rejecting its key tax reform proposal.

title: DeSantis Gets a Standing Ovation in Iowa as Signs of a 2024 Race Mount
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis sent his strongest signal yet that he’s barreling toward a widely-expected 2024 presidential bid with his first visit to Iowa just as a state poll showed that he’s neck-and-neck with former President Donald Trump in terms of favorability among Iowa’s Republican voters.

title: Manhattan DA Probing Trump Is Prosecuting the Victim, Ex-President’s Lawyer Says
description: New York state prosecutors investigating Donald Trump over hush money paid to a porn star are prosecuting the victim, the former president’s lawyer said.

title: Sunak Wouldn’t Follow Johnson in Giving His Father a Knighthood
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said he wouldn’t award his own father a knighthood, speaking ahead of the publication of Boris Johnson’s resignation honors list.

title: New Dutch Curbs on China Sales Target Three ASML Chip Machines
description: New Dutch curbs on the export of semiconductor technology to China are planning to block sales of three additional models of ASML Holding NV’s lithography machines, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: California’s Newsom Seeks Federal Disaster Declaration as Rivers Swell
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom sought a federal disaster declaration as the first of two back-to-back storms brought heavy rains, flooding rivers and evacuation warnings across a state battered by months of extreme weather.

title: China Has Lead Over Russia In Hypersonic Weapons, DIA Says
description: China is ahead of Russia in development of hypersonic weapons and may have already deployed a weapon capable of hitting US bases in the Pacific, the Defense Intelligence Agency said.

title: Inflation Going in Right Direction, Biden Says After Jobs Data
description: The US economy is “headed in the right direction” with slowing inflation, President Joe Biden said after a mixed jobs report eased bets that the Federal Reserve will accelerate its interest rate hikes.

title: Trump ‘Access Hollywood’ Tape Can Be Played at Carroll Trial
description: A federal judge rejected former President Donald Trump’s effort to block the so-called Access Hollywood tape from being played at the upcoming trial in a defamation case brought by E. Jean Carroll, a New York author who claims he raped her in the 1990s.

title: House Conservatives Outline Spending Cuts to Raise Debt Limit
description: Republican conservatives in the House Freedom Caucus are demanding at least $3 trillion in spending cuts over a decade in exchange for supporting an increase in the debt ceiling, an opening bid in negotiations that is sure to be rejected by President Joe Biden and Democrats.

title: Manchin Threatens to Block More Biden Nominees as He Blasts White House
description: Senator Joe Manchin is threatening to hold up more of President Joe Biden’s nominees, escalating a clash with the White House over its implementation of energy provisions in Democrats’ signature climate law.

title: Government Warned HS2 May Never Be Resurrected After Cost-Saving Delays
description: HS2 is at risk of being "dismembered" and never resurrected after further delays were announced by the Government, peers have heard.

title: Sunak Seals Migration Deal With Macron to Move Past Acrimony
description: Rishi Sunak struck an multi-year deal with Emmanuel Macron to curb cross-Channel immigration in small boats, as the two former investment bankers sought to turn the page on years of Anglo-French acrimony.

title: Yellen Affirms Inflation Goal, Warns Lawmakers on Debt Ceiling
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Friday that bringing down inflation remained the administration’s top priority as she doubled down on her calls to Congress to increase the federal debt limit in order to avoid a “catastrophe.”

title: Macron Tells Protesting Unions Pension Reform Is Unavoidable
description: French President Emmanuel Macron told the country’s protesting labor unions in a letter that it’s necessary to work longer to preserve the pension system, sticking to his plan to raise the retirement age to 64 from 62.

title: Chile’s Private Health-Care System Is on Verge of Collapse, Testing Boric
description: Fresh off a bruising defeat in Congress, Chilean President Gabriel Boric is now coming under intense pressure to solve the country’s next political crisis, a private health-care system that’s on the verge of collapse.

title: First Turkish Official Quits After Deadly February Earthquakes
description: The governor of the earthquake-hit province of Adiyaman in Turkey resigned from his post, becoming the first official to step down after the devastating earthquakes that struck the country’s southeast on Feb. 6.

title: Putin Decree Puts Popular Route Out of Russian Assets on Pause
description: New Russian rules are complicating a popular route for investors to exit their holdings by selling their securities to brokerages in so-called friendly nations.

title: US Not Seeking Technology Decoupling From China, Raimondo Says
description: The US government will be watchful of China getting access to critical technology used for military purposes, Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said on Friday.

title: Turkey Blocks Transit of Goods Sanctioned by EU, US to Russia
description: Turkey abruptly stopped the transit of sanctioned goods to Russia this month as the European Union and the US pressure allies to support measures imposed over President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Will Putin Attend G-20 Summit in India? Kremlin Clears His Diary
description: The Kremlin is opening up Vladimir Putin’s schedule around this year’s G-20 summit in India in September to make it possible for the Russian president to participate in the leaders’ gathering after skipping the last two, according to people familiar with the planning.

title: Windsor Framework Not Yet Acceptable, DUP MP Warns
description: A senior DUP MP has said he would advise party colleagues to oppose the new Brexit deal on Northern Ireland trade if further movement is not secured.

title: Iran Says Deal Reached With Saudi Arabia to Restore Ties
description: Iran and Saudi Arabia agreed to restore diplomatic relations, Iranian state-run news outlets said, in a move likely to ease tensions between two geopolitical rivals in the Persian Gulf that have rattled oil markets.

title: GOP’s Graham Plans Carbon-Import Fee as Idea Gains With Party
description: Another Republican senator said he’s planning to introduce legislation that would slap tariffs on carbon-intensive imports, an idea gaining traction with the GOP as a climate solution.

title: No Quick Route to Agree UK-EU Migrant Returns Deal, Sunak Says
description: A deal to return migrants to countries in the European Union can only be agreed in the longer term, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, as he met French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris at the first Franco-British summit in five years.

title: Latvia Begins Shipping Cars Seized From Drunk Drivers to Ukraine
description: Cars seized by Latvian authorities as part of drunk-driving violations are being shipped to Ukraine in an act of solidarity with the war-battered country.

title: US Envoy Calls on Hungary’s Orban to Pivot from Russia ‘Now’
description: The US ambassador to Hungary said Prime Minister Viktor Orban has reached a crossroads and that the “time is now” for him to pivot away from Russia and shore up the country’s relations with its western allies.

title: Here Come the 2024 Presidential Ads. And They’re for Biden
description: A Democratic super-PAC is coming out early — and big — for the 2024 presidential race, launching ads in battleground states to tout President Joe Biden’s economic agenda.

title: Xi’s Triumph Leaves Only One Man to Blame in China
description: For five years, much of Chinese politics has turned on Xi Jinping’s unrelenting quest for a third term. Now he’s got to own it.

title: Spain Sees EU Closer than Ever to Unlock Mercosur Trade Deal
description: Spain is confident the European Union can finally unlock a free-trade agreement with a group of South American countries including Brazil and Argentina, injecting momentum into a process that has dragged on for decades.

title: Trump Calls the Latest Special Counsel a 'Monster.' His Lawyer Used to Call Him a Friend
description: James Trusty and Jack Smith worked together — and respected each other — at the Justice Department. Now they're on opposite sides of the Trump probes

title: Why UK Tories Resent Europe’s Human Rights Court
description: In its seven-decade history, only two nations have abandoned the European Convention on Human Rights: Greece during a period of military rule, and Vladimir Putin’s Russia. The treaty’s basic principles — covering things like free elections, respect for property rights and access to education — are hardly controversial. Yet to some lawmakers in Britain’s governing Conservative party, the European Court of Human Rights that enforces the convention represents the kind of meddling, supranational ins

title: Georgian Lawmakers Drop ‘Foreign Agent’ Bill in Bow to Protests
description: Georgian lawmakers voted to reject a “foreign agent” bill at an emergency session following violent clashes between police and protesters and blunt international criticism.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan to Kick Off Toughest Election Campaign of His 20-Year Rule
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan will officially kick off the toughest election campaign of his career on Friday, with the broadest-ever opposition alliance standing between him and a third decade in power.

title: Explainer: How Singapore’s First Family Feud Over a Keeps Growing
description: The long-running feud in Singapore’s most prominent family started over a house, then moved into the political realm. Now the police are involved. Lee Hsien Yang, the youngest child of the city-state’s first prime minister, Lee Kuan Yew, is being investigated for allegedly giving false evidence in a case involving the handling of his father’s final will. Despite having moved to Europe last year, he says he’s now considering a run for the presidency at home, where he could be a thorn in the side

title: Missile Strikes and a Display of People Power: The Political Week in Photos
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for the rapid   restoration of power supplies after Russia unleashed another campaign of missile strikes targeting civilian infrastructure, including with weapons against which Ukraine has no defense. The US called the attacks “brutal, unjustified.”

title: Eight People Killed in Hamburg Church Shooting, German Police Say
description: HAMBURG, Germany (AP) — A shooting at a Jehovah's Witnesses hall in the German city of Hamburg killed eight people, apparently including the perpetrator, police said Friday. An unspecified number of other people were wounded, some of them seriously.

title: Ukraine Latest: EU Denounces ‘Indiscriminate’ Missile Attacks
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen condemned what she called Russia’s “indiscriminate” missile attacks on Ukraine and said the Kremlin’s “deliberate targeting” of civilians and energy infrastructure is a war crime.

title: Biden and EU’s Von Der Leyen Seek Truce on Trade: What to Watch
description: President Joe Biden and European Commission leader Ursula von der Leyen will likely make their meeting at the White House on Friday convivial, despite trade tensions and the pressure of the war in Ukraine.

title: NATO’s Call for Weapons Offers Hope to Town That Armed the Enemy
description: Czechoslovakia’s defense industry collapsed when the Cold War ended. Now companies are reviving plants that once supplied the Warsaw Pact.

title: Only One Chinese Official Got a ‘No’ Vote at Xi’s Coronation
description: Li Hongzhong has built a reputation as the Chinese official most eager to heap praise on leader Xi Jinping. Now he has a new distinction: the only nominee to receive a “no” vote this year for a leadership role in the country’s legislature.

title: Xi’s Casual Chats on Stage Show Closeness With New China Leaders
description: Xi Jinping’s casual chats with his top lieutenants on China’s most high-profile political stage Friday provided fresh evidence to theories of the strong chemistry among the country’s new leadership team.

title: India and Australia Boost Defense Ties and Bond Over Cricket
description: India and Australia are planning new military drills to strengthen security cooperation as Prime Minister Narendra Modi turned on the charm to welcome his counterpart to the South Asian country for a first official visit.

title: US-China Downward Spiral Raises Fresh Fears of Eventual Conflict
description: China and the US have locked themselves into a new cycle of recriminations, provoking fresh worries that the world’s two biggest economies are heading down a path that could one day lead to the once unthinkable: the possibility of open conflict.

title: Harris to Host Executives, Workers as White House Courts Labor
description: Vice President Kamala Harris will host corporate leaders and union members who work for their companies at the White House on Friday, as part of an effort to encourage corporations to engage with organized labor.

title: Ueda Gets Green Light to Take Over BOJ’s Challenges From Kuroda
description: Japan’s parliament gave a green light for veteran economics professor Kazuo Ueda to take the helm of the Bank of Japan next month in the first change of governor in a decade.

title: Trump Invited to Testify Before NY Grand Jury, Signaling Indictment May Be Near
description: NEW YORK (AP) — Former President Donald Trump has been invited to testify next week before a New York grand jury that has been investigating hush money payments made on his behalf during his 2016 presidential campaign, according to a news report.

title: UK Suspects Russians Using British Firms to Launder War Profits
description: Investigators zero in on shell companies with Russian officers and people say one firm may be shipping Ukrainian grain illegally

title: Macron and Sunak Seek a Reconciliation in Paris: What to Watch
description: Emmanuel Macron and Rishi Sunak will aim to turn the page on years of acrimonious relations between their countries when the British premier travels to Paris on Friday.
